comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: I don't know if I failed to prove your point or I just didn't understand what you're trying to communicate but having real experiences like working at McDonald's, or cleaning cars or gas stations will not make you a better chance if you are compared to people who are rich and have not practiced any hard work their whole life.In fact, your words will be correct in the case of wars and assault on wealth, where the poor tend to defend the little that they possess with all their strength, in contrast to the rich who quickly lose their money according to the rule, Easy Come, Easy Go.

comments.author: MArsland
comments.body: Your description is too ambiguous and convoluted even though in essence you are cornering education and several other social aspects that need to be reconsidered. It's a shame that patterns of thought like yours are too exaggerated or simply don't have a complex knowledge base. In conclusion, you are talking about education -> work -> economy -> politics -> social -> society and so on.No one really works according to idealism, they work to meet their own needs even though the political path they take is still the main need or personal interest which is prioritized above all else. Education is still education with the title of humanizing humans, but looking back learning theory is not enough. Today the material in schools is increasingly converging on information and communication technology education.

comments.author: MarjorieZimmermanGinger
comments.body: The state is unable to guarantee that anyone will become richer?Education is also unable to make people richer and more sensitive to social and cultural values.But in living a life, humans need education, work, economic guarantees, political rights and social values, these are basic needs in living the life of a nation. Responsibility for the future of children cannot be separated from the role of parents in educating, preparing, providing guarantees for education and health as a basis. If all problems must always be seen as the government's mistakes in managing the country, then where is the function as parents?Working as the fulfillment of rights and responsibilities, is a job that cannot be separated from every individual who is of sufficient age, because outwardly they themselves have the most role in doing the job.

comments.body: Quote from: Fullbear2222 on December 27, 2022, 02:20:16 PMThe best way for the rich kids IS forget about your wealth and go do regular work and try to get as many experinces Even not pleasent experinces to get skills and experinces about Life becouse your opponents will have it all and If you not smart skilled and experinced as they are then prepare foryourself for the broke and homeless life.That's reality how things Will go If wealthy but lazy people don't improve themselfes Most rich kids end up wasting inherited fortune because they are not exposed to financial management. They end up wasting money on luxury and other unnecessary pleasures of life. As you rightly pointed out, every child should be allowed to explore and use his gifts and talents to create wealth or a means of survival. Rich parents that want to hand over their businesses to their children must start exposing them to these businesses on time so that they would be very skillful before they inherit them. But some of these wealthy parents make the mistake of just sending their children to renowned schools that just teach theoretical concepts that lack practical experiences. They end up gaining the best degrees without relevant exposure or life experience. They end up with the view that life is all about enjoyment because they have never been exposed to handwork. I was close to a young man in my area his father left behind so much wealth. He ended up selling all the companies and properties. He even sold the house he was living in and moved to a hotel. He died wretchedly in a single room in a public residence by suspected suicide.
